body:
Use this service to send a completed application to become a property and financial affairs deputy to the Court of Protection. 

You can only use this service if you have a Payment By Account (PBA) number to pay for the application.

If you don't have a PBA account, you can [apply for one](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/form-fee-account-application-form-fee-account-customer-application-form).

You can also apply by post.

The application fee is Â£365.

extraComponents.html:
### Before you start

You should read the guidance on how to [apply to become a court-appointed deputy](https://www.gov.uk/become-deputy/apply-deputy).

You also need to complete the following forms:

* [Application (COP1)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/apply-to-make-decisions-on-someones-behalf-form-cop1)
* [Supporting information (COP1A)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/apply-to-make-decisions-on-someones-behalf-property-and-finance-form-cop1a)
* [Assessment of capacity (COP3)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/make-a-report-on-someones-capacity-to-make-decisions-form-cop3)
* [Deputy's declaration (COP4)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/apply-to-become-someones-deputy-make-a-declaration-form-cop4)

You can type your signature on these forms instead of writing it by hand.

heading: Send a completed property and financial affairs application to the Court of Protection
